verbs.description: forbid (third-person singular simple present forbids, present participle forbidding, simple past forbade or forbad or forbid, past participle forbidden)

examples: Smoking in the restaurant is forbidden.

entries.meaning: (ditransitive) To deny, exclude from, or warn off, by express command.
(transitive) To oppose, hinder, or prevent, as if by an effectual command.
examples: An impassable river forbids the approach of the army.
What part of "no" do you forbid to understand?
